thread.title: Oklahoma Inmate Was Given Wrong Drug in Execution, Autopsy Shows
thread.title_full: Oklahoma Inmate Was Given Wrong Drug in Execution, Autopsy Shows - WSJ

author: Ashby Jones
title: Oklahoma Inmate Was Given Wrong Drug in Execution, Autopsy Shows
text:
An Oklahoma death-row inmate was given an unapproved drug as part of his lethal-injection protocol earlier this year, according to his autopsy report, a development likely to fuel the current national debate over execution methods.
Charles Warner, convicted of the rape and murder of an 11-month-old girl, was executed in January under a state-approved protocol that calls for three drugs: a sedative and a paralytic, followed by a drug... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
